required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Restoring Black Triangle With Bioclear Matrix Versus Celluloid Conventional Matrix Method
clinical_study.official_title: Restoring Black Triangle With Bioclear Matrix and Injection Molding Technique Versus Celluloid Conventional Matrix Method: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Assessment of bioclear matrix and injection molding technique against conventional celluloid matrix technique in management of black triangle.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with black triangle defect in anterior teeth (Cl I and Cl II according to Nordland and Tarnow classification) managed by Bioclear matrix with injection molding technique and conventional celluloid matrix technique.

primary_outcome.description: Scoring system according to World Dental Federation (FDI) criteria

secondary_outcome.description: Scoring system according to FDI criteria from one to five one represents very good clinically restoration & five represents poor clinically restoration

other_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) from zero to ten ,zero represents none & ten represent sever

arm_group.description: Conventional celluloid matrix technique in management of black triangle
Bioclear cervical matrix with injection molding technique in management of black triangle

intervention.intervention_name: Conventional celluloid matrix technique in management of black triangle
intervention.description: conventional restorative technique in management of black triangle

intervention.intervention_name: Bioclear cervical matrix with injection molding technique
intervention.description: New restorative technique in management of black triangle restorative papilla regeneration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients eligible for the trial must comply with all of the following:
- Cl I and cl II according to Nordland and Tarnow classification
- Good oral hygiene
- Good general health
- Cooperative patient
- Subjects who signed the informed consent
- Patient compliance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cl III according to Nordland and Tarnow classification
- Uncontrolled parafunction.
- Insufficient oral hygiene
- Periodontal and gingival diseases
- Pregnant and nursing
- Disabilities
- Systemic disease or severe medical complications
- Lack of compliance

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer in conservative department of faculty of dentistry
